verse: [Therefore] Six days before the Passover Feast, Jesus went to Bethany, where Lazarus lived. (Lazarus is the man Jesus raised from the dead.)
There they had a dinner for Jesus. Martha served the food, and Lazarus was one of the people ·eating [reclining; it was customary to eat formal meals while reclining around a low table] with Jesus.

[Then] Mary brought in a pint [Greek litra; about eleven ounces, weighing just under a pound] of very expensive ·perfume [ointment/fragrant oil] made from pure nard. She ·poured the perfume on [anointed; not the word for royal or priestly anointing, but for hospitality or care] Jesus’ feet, and then she wiped his feet with her hair. And the ·sweet smell [fragrance] from the perfume filled the whole house.
Judas Iscariot, one of Jesus’ ·followers [disciples] who would later ·turn against [betray] him, was there. Judas said,
“This ·perfume [ointment/fragrant oil] was worth an ·entire year’s wages [three hundred denarii]. Why wasn’t it sold and the money given to the poor?”
But Judas did not really care about the poor; he said this because he was a thief. He was the one who kept the money ·box [or bag], and he often stole from it.
[Therefore] Jesus answered, “Leave her alone. It was right for her to save this perfume for today, the day for me to be prepared for burial.
[For] You will always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me.”
A large crowd of ·people [Jews] ·heard [learned; came to know] that Jesus was ·in Bethany [there]. So they went there to see not only Jesus but Lazarus, whom Jesus raised from the dead.
So the leading [chief] priests ·made plans [plotted; counseled together] to kill Lazarus too.
Because of Lazarus many of the Jews were ·leaving [going away from; deserting] them and believing in Jesus.
The next day a great crowd who had come to Jerusalem for the Passover Feast [the annual festival celebrating God’s rescue of Israel from Egypt; Ex. 12; John 2:13] heard that Jesus was coming there.
So they took branches of palm trees [a symbol of the nation of Israel] and went out to meet Jesus, shouting,
Jesus found a ·colt [young donkey] and sat on it. ·This was as the Scripture says [As it is written],

The ·followers [disciples] of Jesus did not understand this at first. But after Jesus was ·raised to glory [glorified], they remembered that this had been written about him and that they had done these things to him.

There had been ·many people [a crowd] with Jesus when he raised Lazarus from the dead and told him to come out of the tomb. Now they were ·telling others [testifying; witnessing] about what Jesus did.
·Many people [A crowd] went out to meet Jesus, because they had heard ·about this miracle [that he had done this sign].
So the Pharisees said to each other, “You can see that ·nothing is going right for us [we are getting nowhere; you are gaining nothing]. Look! The whole world ·is following [has gone after] him.”
There were some Greek people [Gentiles—here meant to represent people from all over the world; 12:19], too, who came to Jerusalem to worship at the Passover Feast.
[So] They went to Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, and ·said [requested], “Sir, we would like to ·see [meet] Jesus.”
Philip told Andrew, and then Andrew and Philip told Jesus.

Jesus ·said to [answered; replied to] them, “The ·time [hour] has come for the Son of Man [a title for the Messiah; Dan. 7:13–14] to ·receive his glory [be glorified; through his death, resurrection, and ascension].
·I tell you the truth [Truly, truly I say to you], a grain of wheat must fall to the ground and die to make ·many seeds [much fruit]. But if it never dies, it remains only a single ·seed [grain].
·Those who [The one who…] love their lives will lose them, but those who hate their lives in this world will ·keep [guard; preserve] ·true life forever [it for eternal life].
Whoever serves me must follow me. Then my servant will be with me everywhere I am. My Father will honor anyone who serves me.
“Now ·I am very [my soul is] troubled. Should I say, ‘Father, save me from this ·time [hour]’? No, ·I came to this time so I could suffer [for this reason I have come to this hour].
Father, ·bring glory to [glorify; honor] your name!”
The crowd standing there, who heard the voice, said it was thunder.
Jesus ·said [responded], “That voice was for your sake, not mine.
Now is the time for the world to be judged; now the ·ruler [prince] of this world [Satan] will be ·thrown down [cast/driven out].
·If [or When] I am lifted up from the earth, I will draw all people ·toward me [to myself].”
Jesus said this to show ·how [what kind of death] he would die.

The crowd ·said [responded to him], “We have heard from the ·law [the Old Testament] that the ·Christ [Messiah] will ·live [remain] forever [Ps. 89:35–37; Is. 9:7; Ezek. 37:25]. So why do you say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up’? Who is this ‘Son of Man’?”

Then Jesus said, “The light will be ·with [among] you for a little longer, so walk while you have the light. Then the darkness will not ·catch [overtake] you. ·If you walk [The one who walks] in the darkness, you will not know where you are going.
·Believe [Put your trust] in the light while you still have it so that you will become children of light.” When Jesus had said this, he left and hid himself from them.

header: Some People Won’t Believe in Jesus

verse: Though Jesus had done many ·miracles [signs; 2:11] in front of the people, they still did not believe in him.
This was to ·bring about [fulfill] ·what [the message/word that] Isaiah the prophet had said:
Isaiah said this because he saw Jesus’ glory and spoke about him.

But many believed in Jesus, even many of the ·leaders [authorities]. But because of the Pharisees, they did not ·say they believed in him [confess/proclaim him/it] for fear they would be put out of the synagogue.
They loved ·praise [glory] from people more than ·praise [glory] from God.
Then Jesus cried out, “Whoever believes in me is really believing in the One who sent me.
Whoever sees me sees the One who sent me.
I have come as light into the world so that whoever believes in me would not ·stay [remain] in darkness.
“Anyone who hears my words and does not ·obey [keep] them, I do not judge, because I did not come to judge the world, but to save the world.
There is a judge for those who ·refuse to believe in [reject] me and do not accept my words. The word I have ·taught [spoken] will ·be their judge [judge them] on the last day.
The things I ·taught [spoke] were not from myself. The Father who sent me ·told [commanded] me what to say and what to ·teach [speak].
And I know that eternal life comes from what the Father commands. So whatever I say is what the Father told me to say.”
